page.title: 08PROBUS DEMONSTRATION GARDENS
page.content: {Probus Demonstration Gardens These gardens are situated beside the main trunk road A390 east of the village of Probus.They are run by the Cornwall Education Committee and are probably unique in Europe.Their purpose is to help all gardeners;for the home gardener to show how he can improve and make the best use of his garden;for the architect & town planner to improve the landscape of towns & villages;& for schools in Cornwall to provide them with plants for teaching purposes,& to show the close connection between plants & medicine,history & geography. They were established in 1971 by Mr.Blake,the County Adviser for Horticultural Education.He chose this exposed hillside site of nearly 7 acres to show that plants grow well under adverse conditions.
